content: Some months have 31 days, others have 30 days. But how many have 28 days?

All months have at least 28 days. In the Gregorian calendar, which is the calendar most commonly used worldwide, every month has at least 28 days. Specifically:

- January has 31 days
- February has 28 days in a common year and 29 days in a leap year
- March has 31 days
- April has 30 days
- May has 31 days
- June has 30 days
- July has 31 days
- August has 31 days
- September has 30 days
- October has 31 days
- November has 30 days
- December has 31 days

Therefore, the answer to the question "How many months have 28 days?" is all 12 months. This is a classic trick question because it plays on the idea that only February has 28 days, but in reality, all months have at least that many days.
